sentence.Network_en: When I grew up, I became a professional astrophysicist.
sentence.Network_cn: 长大之后, 我成了一名职业的天体物理学家.

sentence.Network_en: Experimental Astrophysicist George Smoot is an active researcher in observational astrophysics and cosmology.
sentence.Network_cn: 试验天体物理学家乔治-斯莫特是一位在活跃天体物理学和宇宙学领域非常活跃的科学家.

sentence.Network_en: Top astrophysicist Sasha Greenberg has spent the past 17 years working in the United States.
sentence.Network_cn: 顶尖天体物理学家萨莎格林伯格在美国工作了17年.

list.abs: most astrophysicists accept the case , since according to general relativity , any concentration of matter of sufficient density must necessarily collapse into a black hole .大多数天体物理学家接受这个情形，自从依照广义相对论，充份密度物质任何集中一定必然坍缩为一个黑洞。

studying the properties of rare isotopes can help astrophysicists explain how the reactions in exploding stars generated the elements that make up Earth and the other planets .对稀有同位素进行研究，可以帮助天文物理学家解释，恒星爆炸的反应如何产生组成地球以及其他行星的各种元素；

entry.def: An astrophysicist is someone who studies astrophysics.

means.word_mean: 1. an astronomer who studies the physical properties of celestial bodies
